Html:
Hi,
is it possible to limit the XrmServiceToolkit.Soap.Fetch() results like 'TOP number' in SQL.
IÂ´ve tried to use "count='number'", but this gets totally ignored as far as I can see in Fiddler.
Here is the complete Fetch: 
function getFetchResult(forYear)
{
    var myFetchXML = "<fetch version='1.0' output-format='xml-platform' mapping='logical' distinct='false' count='1'>" +
                        "<entity name='account'>" +
                          "<attribute name='name' />" +
                          "<attribute name='accountid' />" +
                          "<attribute name='vfw_siegelnummer' />" +
                          "<attribute name='od4u_laufvariable' />" +
                          "<attribute name='od4u_jahresnummer' />" +
                          "<order attribute='od4u_laufvariable' descending='true' />" +
                          "<filter type='and'>" +
                            "<condition attribute='od4u_jahresnummer' operator='eq' value='" + forYear + "' />" +
                          "</filter>" +
                        "</entity>" +
                      "</fetch>";

    return XrmServiceToolkit.Soap.Fetch(myFetchXML);
}

Hi There.

I do believe there is a way in general to limit the number of records by using page and count in the fetch. For example,

"<fetch version='1.0' output-format='xml-platform' mapping='logical' distinct='false' page='1' count='1'>"

However, the current version of the toolkit has modified the fetch method to allow user only put <entity name=....> to start by using the fetch. Therefore the content of the fetch statement has ben ignored except aggregate.

I am currently updating the toolkit to 2.0.1 and hopefully will have some better approach for the fetch method.

Regards,
Jaimie

Hi Jaimie,

First, thanks for your work and the quality of your development.

Do you know when the version 2.0.1 will be available ?

Best regards,
Nicolas

Hi.
